faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: Have questions? We've compiled the most frequently asked questions about investing, entrepreneuring and working in Portugal. If you can't find the answer, we're here to help.
faq.q1: How long does it take to open a company in Portugal?
faq.a1: The process varies between 2 to 4 weeks, depending on the type of company and documentation. We accompany the entire process, from choosing the legal structure to registering with the Tax Authority and Social Security.
faq.q2: Do I need to be in Portugal to apply for European funds?
faq.a2: Not necessarily. You can start the process remotely, but presence in Portugal is recommended for certain stages, such as opening a bank account and signing documents. We guide you on when presence is mandatory.
faq.q3: What visas exist for entrepreneurs and investors?
faq.a3: Portugal offers the Golden Visa (minimum investment), Startup Visa (for innovative projects), D2 Visa (entrepreneurs), and D7 (passive income). Each has specific requirements that we evaluate with you.
faq.q4: How do I know if I'm eligible for Portugal 2030 funds?
faq.a4: Eligibility depends on the sector, company size, location and project type. We provide a free analysis of your situation and identify the best financing opportunities available.
